content.description: Stand start on two bad crimps and climb directly up, eliminating the rail, but using the dish and crimp holds immediately beneath it. Keep climbing straight up on bad crimps - do not veer right. If you use the rail, this is just Unworthy.
content.location: Toward the eastern edge of Rat rock, directly beneath the lowest, juggiest part of the rail.

content.description: Pretty Famous Problem   Starts on Far Left of the East Face of Rat Rock.. Starts on two nothing holds and dynos to a lip (crux). Very hard move due to lack of feet and razor edge holds. After dyno you have to move up to a circular plate shaped piece around 3-4 feet up. Easy top out thereafter. There are small crimps on right leading up which could be utilized. Heel hook on lip could help.   Super sandbagged feels like a 6/6+
content.protection: Pads and Spotters optional. Dangerous from all the rocks only if you fall sideways
content.location: Rat Rock East Face near the children's park. To the far left you will see two RAZOR HOLDS.. Dyno from those to lip!

content.description:
Starts on hold next to flake, then move to flake.. Throw left hand all the way to the left hand hold of tweaky shit.. Flag really hard and fall into with right hand (crux). A lot of fun! No use of small island, feet must stay on wall. V3 

  Variation: start on left of tweaky shit on the holds that are the rat rock Dyno then use any holds and the small island to get into tweaky shit V2
content.location: Rat rock, starts to the left of tweaky shit

content.description: Sit start on left hand crimp left to right hand undercling with a toe out right (not on "island" foot) and then move straight up thought crips.

About 5 feet left of the flake, find a small crimpy set of holds over head height. The right hand hold has been broken off and epoxied back on (like about 20 other holds here), the left is a crescent shaped situation that is equal parts sidepull and crimper. Once feet are on the rock shoot for the rail above, then crystals above that, and topout straight up.    Getting off the ground is the crux. 

  Harder variations include traversing into this from the flake directly to the right (or beyond);   or starting on the left hand gaston/right hand crimp below the start holds mentioned above with a toe out right near the ground, then moving up into the original start position (v3+?).
content.location: East face of Rat Rock, Between the oak trees but closer to tree on climber's left.

content.description: Harder version of Toothless. Only a few moves, same sit start as Rat Patrol and Testpiece, but enjoyable. Refer to photo for the holds.
content.location: Undercling of the flake, be sure not to use sidepull section, as this negates the difficulty of the sit start

content.description: A "new" variation on "Rat Patrol" (with the usual caveat that I'm sure somebody did it years ago).Starting from the same two start holds as "Rat Patrol" and "Test Piece", bump left hand up to the right-facing gaston (same as the right-hand crux hold of "Tweaky Shit"). Set feet, and throw right hand to the horizontal slot/crack in the face of the flake. Reset feet again, and slap left hand to the rail. Top out however you want.Two pretty tough moves, and very shouldery. For full value, avoid the flake or any holds to the right of it for feet.

A tough one-move-wonder, with a crux move very atypical for Rat Rock. Fun to mess around with, between attempts on more inspiring projects.

 Starting on an okay-ish crimp and a good side pull, come into an undercling-pinch on the bottom of the prominent horn. Use only this hold to reach all the way to the half-moon jug. Top out directly.
content.location: Directly under the horn on the east face of Rat.

content.description: Sit start of Testpiece. Use undercling section of the flake, not the sidepull section, as this negates the difficulty of the sit start. Though Testpiece is originally a sit start, many broken holds have led to two different problems being established: Testpiece stand, from two crystal crimps; and Testpiece Sit. Power up into the same tooth hold and climb direct, topping out while avoiding the rail.
content.location: Sit start on two rocks and undercling section of the flake. Everything on for Testpiece Stand is on; what's off is off here too.

content.description: Start with both hands on the low bulge (same start as for "Mother's Milk"). With a wide stance, reach left hand up to a small (but positive) three-finger dish; move right hand to a sharp (but good) broken side-pull next to it. Reset feet and make a somewhat hard static move, bringing left hand into the small horizontal crack on the face of the flake. Reset feet again, and reach right hand up to a hold above the flake (the flake itself is off). Traverse some amount left down the rail, and finish through the large crystals above "Tweaky Shit" (same finish as for "The Flake", from here).
content.protection: No pad needed, maybe a spot for the higher moves.
content.location:
Starts on the low chalked up bulge, between the flake and the horn, on the east face of Rat.

 Small extension of route #17: http://www.beta-boy.com/nycboulderingguide/id7.html

content.description: Between the sharp flake on the east face and a sloping rail, see a series of edges. Start low, making a move into the horizontal slots, finishing with a throw to the sloper at the top of the rail (avoiding the lower, more positive part of the rail). Sit start on the undercling of the flake (as opposed to the sidepull)
content.location: Rat rock east face, left of the prominent lieback flake

content.description: Climb up the face 6 feet right of Rat Hole chimney using face holds.
content.location: 6 feet or so right of Chimney on East Face of Rat Rock.

content.description: Sit start variation to Rat Patrol. Use undercling section of the flake, not the sidepull section, as this negates the difficulty of the sit start. Power up into LH hold (same as RH hold of Tweaky Shit crux) and proceed like Rat Patrol Stand.
content.protection: Woodchip fall, no pad or spotter needed

content.description:
A classic line of crimps up the face of the flake, on the east side of Rat Rock. Slightly contrived, but great movements.

 Begin with hands on the two round crystal holds low on the face of the flake. Bump left hand to the flat crystal edge, and then a gaston (same hold as the right-hand side pull of Tweaky Shit). Set feet, and move right hand to the prominent crimpy "tooth" hold. Move directly to the rail (crux), either by tossing straight up or by utilizing a sneaky drop-knee. Top out through the big crystals above.
content.location: East face of Rat, on the right side of the face of the flake.

content.description: Climb the chimney to the right of the horn.
Sit Start on bulge in the middle of the face and work straight up the crimps without using the horn or flakes.
Climb from the bulge hold up to the horn and mantel to top out.
content.location: On the east face of Rat Rock, below the big horn that juts out right of the flake.

content.description:
Move up the flake until you can reach out left and gain the long rail.  Climb straight up.   A true classic. 

  Variation:  Flake/Crystal follows the flake up and right and to the top via a somewhat hidden crystal hold.  V1
content.location: At the tallest, steepest section of the eastern face, find an obvious, large right-facing flake that arcs up right.

content.description: Climb up to the horn, and traverse left. Move across the flake, and continue left onto the rail. Top out through the flakes, where the rail ends.
content.protection: Definetely going to want a pad where the rail ends - The landing is bad, exactly when you're most pumped.

content.description:
Follows a line of side-pulls direct, staying left of the flakes at the far left end of the rail used for "The Flake" and "Death By Dizzy". 

  Start on the low, good hold; top out direct. Crux hits near the top.
content.protection: Definetely a pad, and one or two spotters - Horrible landing over rocks, with falls not totally unlikely. Can be made safe with attentive spotters, though.

content.description: This is a low left to right traverse of the crimpy part of the East face. Start below the "Unworthy" starting crimps with a right hand crimp and left hand thumb catch. Left foot starts on a sharp rock on the ground, pistol squat to gain the rock island (same one used in "Tweaky Shit") with your right foot. Traverse right, staying low, until you reach the flake, then climb "The Flake" to top out. Described in the Gunks Apps guide and attributed to Yuki Ikumori. Very balancy, many possible betas to traverse the face.
Enter a description of this area.
